title: Stabilize build/deployment and perform full application smoke-test fixes

requirements.text: Identify and fix the root cause of the deployment failure so the project can build and deploy successfully end-to-end.

quotes: üôè Something went wrong with the deployment

acceptanceCriteria: A full build completes without errors (frontend bundling and Motoko compilation).
A full deploy completes successfully with no deployment-step errors.
No new build-time warnings are introduced that indicate broken configuration (e.g., missing assets, missing environment values, broken imports).

requirements.text: Run and fix a complete frontend runtime smoke test of the single-page site: all sections render, navigation scroll targets work, and all external links open correctly without console errors.

quotes: fix the record on everything make sure all is working 100 percent

acceptanceCriteria: Visiting the app shows the header, hero, try-demo, capabilities, how-it-works, safety/security, use-cases, FAQ, contact, and footer sections with no blank/undefined content.
Header navigation buttons scroll to the correct section IDs (hero, capabilities, how-it-works, safety-security, use-cases, faq, contact).
All ‚ÄúTry the Demo‚Äù/‚ÄúLaunch Demo Environment‚Äù links open https://nexusforgeai.base44.app/Chat in a new tab and do not throw errors.
Submitting the contact form triggers the mailto flow and does not throw runtime errors.
Browser console shows no uncaught exceptions during normal interaction (scrolling, opening mobile menu, clicking nav, clicking CTAs, submitting contact form).

requirements.text: Add a minimal backend health surface (non-breaking) to confirm the canister is deployed and callable, and wire a simple frontend check to display a clear failure state if the backend is unreachable.

quotes: make sure all is working 100 percent

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes a simple query method (e.g., returning a static string/version) that compiles and is callable after deploy.
Frontend performs a lightweight check (on load or via a diagnostics UI element) and shows an English, user-friendly message if the backend cannot be reached.
The health check does not require authentication and does not modify persistent state.
No changes are made to immutable frontend hook files; the implementation composes with the existing actor/auth setup.

requirements.text: Audit and fix any broken/missing static assets referenced by the UI (especially images under /assets/generated) so that all images load without 404s after deployment.
acceptanceCriteria: All referenced static asset URLs resolve successfully (no 404s) in the deployed environment.
Hero/background and logo assets (if referenced) load correctly in both light and dark mode contexts.
No static assets are served through the backend; assets remain in the frontend public directory pathing.

constraints: Do not edit files in frontend immutablePaths (frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui).
Keep the demo URL behavior unchanged: https://nexusforgeai.base44.app/Chat must remain the external demo destination where currently used.
Respect the single-actor Motoko architecture; keep all Motoko logic in backend/main.mo and add migration only if existing stable state would otherwise break.
nonGoals: Do not introduce new product features beyond what is required to restore successful build/deploy and verify operability.
Do not add third-party services (analytics, email providers, external databases, or third-party auth).
Do not redesign the site or change marketing copy except where strictly necessary to fix broken UI behavior or errors.
